__e: Yes, I remember, and I recall the affair, but what one has to do with the other...?
And that is a treason in itself.
She tells him, not about herself effectively cheating him, but about fantasising about cheating him with some naval officer they met in a hotel and so on and so on.
We have told you of your father's treason.
You found out about your husband's affair a week before the wedding.
Your mother's treachery is old news.
Even if the straying's with her own husband?
That would be murder, not to mention treason, and that's not who we are.
Well, you know what they say-- betrayal is in the eye of the beholder.
What about the ones who aren't married?
You can face death 24 hours a day, but the possibility of betrayal never enters your head.
and just when I thought his betrayal couldn't cut any deeper, I learned that his actual true love was someone very close to me...
Betrayal is in your nature, boy.
The penalty for treason is death.
Now, people in prison for treason, they exist outside of the legal system.
I understand, and I would have to be a criminal, or criminally insane, to do that, but I could be facing a charge oftreason, for God's sake.
Yeah, a betrayal for which I've only just begun to forgive you, but you are my blood.
I reckon it takes a betrayal before you realize the real currency in the world ain't money... it's trust.
